> We are implementing unit testing on our projects, and the use of mock
> objects is a great step to isolate the CUT.
>
> After several attempts we have find 2 solutions that permits the use of mock
> objects, that derives from these assumptions:
>
> 1. Good class design: when design classes, you design only the interfaces of
> these classes, and when you code these classes, implements the interfaces.
> In this way, you can define a mock object for this class
>
> 2. Never instantiate directly a class into a method.
> [...]

exactly!
